alert.note: Alert for Bell; Coryell; Lampasas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 20 at 4:52PM CDT until April 20 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Coryell County in central Texas... Northeastern Lampasas County in central Texas... Northern Bell County in central Texas... * Until 545 PM CDT. * At 450 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Pidcoke to Killeen to Moody, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Killeen, Temple, Copperas Cove, Harker Heights, Belton, Fort Hood, Nolanville, Morgan`s Point Resort, Little River-Academy, Troy, Kempner, Belton Lake, Stillhouse Hollow Lake, Mother Neff State Park, Union Grove, White Hall, Moffat, Izoro, Owl Creek and Meadow Grove. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 289 and 312. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection get inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Heavy rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
